intro: Corethrogyne floccosa, commonly known as the woolly corethrogyne, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is a member of the Onagraceae family, which includes species like willows and evening primroses. The plant is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and plant enthusiasts.
